name: Chocolate Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease and flour two nine-inch round pans.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla.
Combine the flour, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder, and salt; add to the creamed mixture alternately with the buttermilk.
Pour into prepared pans.
Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes, then remove to wire racks to cool completely.

name: Vanilla Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease and flour two nine-inch round pans.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract.
Combine the flour, baking powder, and salt; add to the creamed mixture alternately with the milk.
Pour into prepared pans.
Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes, then remove to wire racks to cool completely.

name: Lemon Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the lemon juice and zest.
Combine the flour, baking powder, and salt; add to the creamed mixture alternately with the milk.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then remove to wire racks to cool completely.

name: Blueberry-Cream Cheese Pastries
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, mix together cream cheese, powdered sugar, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Unroll puff pastry sheet onto a lightly floured surface. Cut into squares.
Spread cream cheese mixture onto each pastry square, leaving a border around the edges.
Place a few blueberries on top of the cream cheese mixture.
Fold pastry squares diagonally to form triangles. Press edges to seal.
In a small bowl, whisk together egg and water to make an egg wash.
Brush egg wash over the pastries.
Bake for 15-18 minutes, or until pastries are golden brown.
Remove from oven and let cool slightly before serving.

name: Potato Cinnamon Rolls
steps: In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, granulated sugar, yeast, and salt.
In a small saucepan, heat milk and butter until butter is melted and mixture is warm.
Add milk mixture to flour mixture, then add egg and mashed potatoes.
Mix until a soft dough forms. Knead dough on a floured surface until smooth and elastic.
Place dough in a greased bowl, cover, and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size (about 1 hour).
Punch down dough and roll out into a rectangle.
In a small bowl, mix together brown sugar and cinnamon. Sprinkle mixture over dough.
Roll up dough tightly, starting from the long side. Cut into slices.
Place slices in a greased baking dish. Cover and let rise again until doubled in size.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Bake rolls for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
In a small bowl, mix together powdered sugar and milk to make icing. Drizzle over warm rolls before serving.

name: Apple-Cheese Danish
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, mix together cream cheese, granulated sugar, egg yolk, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Unroll puff pastry sheet onto a lightly floured surface. Cut into squares.
Spread cream cheese mixture onto each pastry square, leaving a border around the edges.
Arrange thinly sliced apples on top of the cream cheese mixture.
Fold pastry squares diagonally to form triangles. Press edges to seal.
In a small bowl, whisk together egg and water to make an egg wash.
Brush egg wash over the pastries.
Bake for 15-18 minutes, or until pastries are golden brown.
Remove from oven and let cool slightly before serving.

name: Almond and Vanilla Bean Scones

ingredients.name: unsalted butter, cold and cut into cubes

steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Add cold butter cubes to the flour mixture. Using a pastry cutter or your fingers, cut the butter into the flour until it resembles coarse crumbs.
In a separate bowl, whisk together heavy cream, egg, almond extract, and vanilla bean seeds.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead gently a few times until it comes together.
Pat the dough into a circle about 1-inch thick. Cut into 8 wedges.
Place the scones onto the prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle sliced almonds on top of each scone, pressing lightly to adhere.
Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until golden brown.
Remove from oven and let cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Cream Cheese Danishes

ingredients.name: fruit preserves (such as raspberry or apricot)

steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, mix together cream cheese, granulated sugar, egg yolk, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Unroll puff pastry sheet onto a lightly floured surface. Cut into squares.
Spread cream cheese mixture onto each pastry square, leaving a border around the edges.
Place a spoonful of fruit preserves in the center of each pastry square.
Fold opposite corners of each pastry square toward the center, slightly overlapping each other. Press edges to seal.
In a small bowl, whisk together egg and water to make an egg wash.
Brush egg wash over the pastries.
Bake for 15-18 minutes, or until pastries are golden brown.
Remove from oven and let cool slightly before serving.

name: Lavender-Honey Lemon Tart
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a food processor, pulse together flour, powdered sugar, and salt until combined.
Add cold butter cubes and pulse until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add egg yolk and ice water, and pulse until dough comes together.
Press dough into a disc, wrap in plastic wrap, and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
Roll out dough on a floured surface and fit into a tart pan. Trim excess dough.
Line tart shell with parchment paper and fill with pie weights or dried beans. Blind bake for 15 minutes.
Remove parchment paper and weights, and bake for an additional 5 minutes, or until crust is lightly golden.
In a small saucepan, heat heavy cream, honey, and lavender buds until just simmering. Remove from heat and let steep for 10 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, granulated sugar, lemon juice, and lemon zest.
Strain lavender-infused cream and gradually whisk into egg mixture.
Pour filling into pre-baked tart shell and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until filling is set.
Allow tart to cool completely before slicing and serving.

name: Chocolate Cannoli
steps: In a medium bowl, combine ricotta cheese, powdered sugar, and vanilla extract. Mix until smooth.
Fold in mini chocolate chips and chopped pistachios.
Spoon filling into a pastry bag fitted with a large round tip.
Pipe filling into each end of the cannoli shells, filling from the center outward.
Dust filled cannoli with confectioners' sugar.
Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

name: Strawberry-Cardamom Turnovers
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, toss together diced strawberries, granulated sugar, ground cardamom, cornstarch, and vanilla extract until well combined.
Roll out thawed puff pastry on a lightly floured surface and cut into squares.
Place a spoonful of the strawberry mixture onto one half of each pastry square.
Fold the other half of the pastry over the filling to form a triangle, then press the edges firmly to seal.
In a small bowl, whisk together egg and water to make an egg wash.
Brush the tops of the turnovers with egg wash.
Transfer the turnovers to the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until golden brown and puffed.
Remove from oven and let cool slightly before dusting with powdered sugar.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

name: Rustic Blood Orange Tart with Salted Pecan Crust
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a food processor, pulse together flour, chopped pecans, granulated sugar, and salt until pecans are finely ground.
Add cold butter cubes and pulse until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Gradually add ice water, 1 tablespoon at a time, and pulse until dough comes together.
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead gently a few times until smooth.
Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Roll out chilled dough on a lightly floured surface into a circle large enough to fit a 9-inch tart pan.
Transfer dough to tart pan and press into the bottom and up the sides. Trim any excess dough.
Prick bottom of crust with a fork and chill in the freezer for 15 minutes.
Line chilled crust with parchment paper and fill with pie weights or dried beans.
Bake for 15 minutes. Remove parchment paper and weights, and bake for an additional 10 minutes, or until lightly golden.
Meanwhile, thinly slice two of the blood oranges and remove any seeds.
In a small saucepan, combine orange marmalade, cornstarch, honey, vanilla extract, and ground cinnamon. Heat over medium heat until mixture begins to thicken.
Arrange sliced blood oranges over partially baked tart crust, overlapping slightly.
Brush orange marmalade mixture over the top of the blood oranges.
Thinly slice remaining blood oranges and arrange on top of the tart.
In a small bowl, whisk together egg and water to make an egg wash.
Brush egg wash around the edges of the tart crust.
Sprinkle coarse sugar over the top of the tart.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly.
Allow tart to cool before serving.

name: Stuffed Churro Puffs
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium saucepan, combine water, butter, and salt. Bring to a boil over medium heat.
Reduce heat to low and add flour all at once. Stir vigorously until mixture forms a ball and pulls away from the sides of the pan.
Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes.
Add eggs, one at a time, stirring well after each addition, until dough is smooth and glossy.
Stir in vanilla extract.
Transfer dough to a piping bag fitted with a large star tip.
Pipe 1-inch mounds of dough onto the prepared baking sheet, leaving space between each mound.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until puffs are golden brown and crisp.
In a shallow dish, combine sugar and cinnamon.
While puffs are still warm, roll each puff in melted butter, then roll in the cinnamon-sugar mixture to coat evenly.
Serve warm and enjoy!

name: Danish Pastry Apple Bars

ingredients.name: apples, peeled, cored, and thinly sliced

steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
In a large mixing bowl, cream together softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in egg and vanilla extract until well combined.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until a dough forms.
Press two-thirds of the dough into the bottom of the prepared baking dish to form a crust.
In a bowl, toss sliced apples with granulated sugar and ground cinnamon until evenly coated.
Arrange the apple slices over the crust in the baking dish.
Roll out the remaining dough between two sheets of parchment paper to fit the baking dish. Carefully place it over the apples.
In a small saucepan, heat apricot preserves and water over low heat until melted and smooth.
Brush the apricot mixture over the top crust.
Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the apples are tender.
Allow to cool completely before slicing into bars.

name: Best Donuts
steps: Warm the milk in a small saucepan until it bubbles, then remove from heat. Mix in white sugar and yeast, and let sit for about 10 minutes, or until frothy.
Beat the eggs and melted butter into the milk mixture. In a separate bowl, combine the flour and salt.
Stir the flour mixture into the milk mixture until a soft dough forms.
Knead dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth. Place in a well oiled bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and set aside to rise until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Punch down dough, and roll out to about 1/2 inch thickness. Cut with a floured donut cutter.
Let doughnuts sit out to rise again until doubled. Cover loosely with a cloth.
Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large heavy skillet to 350°F (175°C). Slide doughnuts into the hot oil using a wide spatula. Turn doughnuts over as they rise to the surface.
Fry doughnuts on each side until golden brown. Remove from hot oil, to drain on a wire rack.
Combine the remaining white sugar and cinnamon. While doughnuts are still warm, roll them in the cinnamon sugar mixture.
Serve warm and enjoy!

name: French Market Beignets
steps: In a large saucepan, combine water, sugar, salt, and vegetable oil. Bring to a rolling boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce heat to low, and stir in flour until mixture forms a ball. Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes.
Heat oil for frying in deep-fryer or deep skillet to 375°F (190°C).
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition, until mixture is smooth and glossy.
Spoon dough into a pastry bag fitted with a large star tip.
Pipe strips of dough into hot oil using a pastry bag. Fry until golden brown, turning once with tongs.
Remove from hot oil to drain on paper towels. Dust with powdered sugar while still warm.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Apple-Toffee Tartlets

ingredients.name: apples, peeled, cored, and thinly sliced

steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Roll out the thawed puff pastry on a lightly floured surface and cut into squares.
In a bowl, toss together sliced apples, toffee bits, brown sugar, and ground cinnamon until evenly coated.
Place a spoonful of the apple mixture onto each pastry square.
Fold the edges of the pastry squares over the filling, forming tartlets.
In a small bowl, whisk together egg and water to make an egg wash.
Brush the edges of the tartlets with the egg wash.
Place the tartlets on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and crispy.
Allow to cool slightly before serving.
Enjoy these delicious apple-toffee tartlets!

name: Chocolate-Almond Croissants
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Slice each croissant in half horizontally.
Place a small handful of chocolate chips and sliced almonds on the bottom half of each croissant.
Replace the top half of each croissant.
In a small bowl, whisk together powdered sugar, milk, and almond extract to make a glaze.
Brush the tops of the croissants with the glaze.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the croissants are heated through and the chocolate is melted.
Serve warm and enjoy these delightful chocolate-almond croissants!

name: Danish Kringle Pastry
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a mixing bowl, cream together softened butter and all-purpose flour until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add cold water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until a dough forms. Divide dough in half.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out each half of the dough into a 12x10-inch rectangle.
In another mixing bowl, beat together softened cream cheese, granulated sugar, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Spread half of the cream cheese mixture down the center of each rectangle, leaving a border around the edges.
Fold the long sides of each rectangle over the filling, overlapping slightly in the center. Pinch edges to seal.
Transfer pastries to a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown and flaky.
Warm apricot preserves in a small saucepan over low heat until melted and smooth.
Brush warm preserves over the warm pastries.
Sprinkle powdered sugar over the pastries.
Slice and serve warm. Enjoy this delicious Danish kringle pastry!

name: Lady Locks
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Roll out the thawed puff pastry on a lightly floured surface and cut into 1-inch strips.
Twist each strip into a spiral shape and place on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown and puffed.
Remove from oven and let cool completely.
In a mixing bowl, beat together softened butter, powdered sugar, vanilla extract, and milk until smooth.
Transfer mixture to a piping bag fitted with a star tip.
Pipe whipped cream onto the flat side of half of the baked puff pastry spirals.
Top with remaining pastry spirals to form sandwiches.
Dust with powdered sugar before serving.
Enjoy these delightful lady locks!

name: Autumn Fruit & Maple Custard Slab Tart

ingredients.name: mixed autumn fruits (such as apples, pears, figs), sliced

steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Roll out the thawed puff pastry on a lightly floured surface and transfer to the prepared baking sheet.
Fold over the edges of the pastry to form a crust, pressing lightly to seal.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, maple syrup, granulated sugar, vanilla extract, and heavy cream until smooth.
Arrange sliced mixed autumn fruits over the prepared puff pastry crust.
Pour the egg mixture over the fruits, making sure they are evenly coated.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the custard is set and the pastry is golden brown.
Remove from oven and let cool slightly before slicing.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
Enjoy this delicious autumn fruit & maple custard slab tart!

name: Gluten Free Coconut Cream and Pineapple Cream Puffs
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium saucepan, combine water, butter, and salt. Bring to a boil over medium heat.
Reduce heat to low and add gluten-free all-purpose flour all at once. Stir vigorously until mixture forms a ball and pulls away from the sides of the pan.
Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes.
Add eggs, one at a time, stirring well after each addition, until dough is smooth and glossy.
Stir in sweetened shredded coconut and finely chopped pineapple until evenly distributed.
Drop spoonfuls of dough onto the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until puffs are golden brown and crisp.
In a mixing bowl, whip heavy cream, powdered sugar, and vanilla extract until stiff peaks form.
Let puffs cool completely on a wire rack.
Once cooled, slice the tops off the puffs and fill with whipped cream.
Replace the tops of the puffs and dust with powdered sugar, if desired.
Serve and enjoy these delightful gluten-free coconut cream and pineapple cream puffs!

name: Shortcut Sugar Buns
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Separate biscuit dough into individual biscuits. Flatten each biscuit slightly with your hands.
In a small bowl, mix together granulated sugar and ground cinnamon.
Brush each biscuit with melted butter, then sprinkle with cinnamon sugar mixture.
Roll up each biscuit jelly-roll style and place on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown.
In a small bowl, whisk together powdered sugar and milk to make a glaze.
Drizzle glaze over warm sugar buns.
Serve and enjoy these quick and delicious shortcut sugar buns!

name: Fried Apple Hand Pies
steps: In a large bowl, combine all-purpose flour and cold, cubed unsalted butter. Use a pastry cutter or your fingers to cut the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Gradually add cold water to the flour mixture, mixing until a dough forms. Shape the dough into a disc, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
In a separate bowl, toss diced apples with granulated sugar, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, and cornstarch until evenly coated.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out the chilled dough to about 1/8 inch thickness. Cut out circles using a cookie cutter or a glass.
Place a spoonful of the apple mixture onto one half of each dough circle. Fold the other half of the dough over the filling to form a half-moon shape. Press the edges to seal, then crimp with a fork.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or heavy-bottomed skillet to 350°F (175°C). Fry hand pies in batches until golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Remove hand pies from the oil and drain on paper towels.
Sprinkle with powdered sugar, if desired, and serve warm.
Enjoy these delicious fried apple hand pies!

name: Spiced Apple Tarte Tatin
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a 10-inch oven-safe skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add granulated sugar, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, ground cloves, and salt to the skillet, stirring until sugar is dissolved and mixture is bubbling.
Add apple halves to the skillet, rounded side down, and cook until caramelized and tender, about 10 minutes.
Remove skillet from heat. Carefully arrange apple halves in a circular pattern, rounded side down, covering the bottom of the skillet.
Roll out thawed puff pastry on a lightly floured surface to fit the skillet. Place pastry over the apples, tucking in the edges.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown and puffed.
Remove from oven and let cool for a few minutes.
Carefully invert the tart onto a serving platter.
Serve warm, optionally with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Enjoy this delicious spiced apple tarte tatin!

name: Jam-Filled Hand Pies

ingredients.name: fruit jam (such as strawberry or raspberry)

steps: In a large bowl, combine all-purpose flour and salt.
Add cold, cubed unsalted butter to the flour mixture. Use a pastry cutter or your fingers to cut the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Gradually add ice water to the flour mixture, mixing until a dough forms.
Shape the dough into a disc, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out the chilled dough to about 1/8 inch thickness.
Using a round cutter, cut out circles from the dough.
Place a spoonful of fruit jam in the center of each dough circle.
Fold the dough over the filling to form a half-moon shape. Press the edges to seal, then crimp with a fork.
In a small bowl, whisk together egg and water to make an egg wash.
Brush the tops of the hand pies with the egg wash, then sprinkle with granulated sugar.
Place hand pies on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
Let cool slightly before serving.
Enjoy these delicious jam-filled hand pies!

name: Lemon Blueberry Bundt Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a bundt cake pan.
In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla extract, lemon juice, and lemon zest.
Mix in flour alternately with sour cream. Toss blueberries with 1 tablespoon of flour, then fold into batter.
Pour batter into prepared bundt cake pan.
Bake for 60-70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then invert onto a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour three 9-inch round cake pans.
In a medium bowl, sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and ground cinnamon.
In a large bowl, beat together eggs, oil, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract until well combined.
Stir in grated carrots, crushed pineapple, chopped walnuts, and flaked coconut.
Gradually add dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Divide batter evenly between the prepared cake pans and smooth the tops with a spatula.
Bake in preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Remove cakes from oven and let cool in pans for 10 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.
While the cakes are cooling, prepare the cream cheese frosting.
In a large bowl, beat together softened butter and cream cheese until smooth and creamy.
Gradually add powdered sugar and vanilla extract, beating until light and fluffy.
Once the cakes are completely cool, spread a layer of cream cheese frosting between each layer and over the top and sides of the cake.
Optional: Garnish with chopped walnuts or shredded coconut.
Refrigerate the cake until ready to serve, allowing the frosting to set.
Slice and enjoy this delicious carrot cake with cream cheese frosting!

name: Red Velvet Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
In a medium bowl, sift together flour, granulated sugar, baking soda, salt, and cocoa powder.
In a large bowl, beat together vegetable oil, buttermilk, eggs, red food coloring, and vanilla extract until well combined.
Gradually add dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
In a small bowl, mix together white vinegar and baking soda until foamy. Fold into cake batter.
Divide batter evenly between the prepared cake pans and smooth the tops with a spatula.
Bake in preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Remove cakes from oven and let cool in pans for 10 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.
Once the cakes are completely cool, spread a layer of cream cheese frosting between the layers and over the top and sides of the cake.
Optional: Garnish with red velvet cake crumbs or chocolate shavings.
Refrigerate the cake until ready to serve, allowing the frosting to set.
Slice and enjoy this classic red velvet cake with cream cheese frosting!

name: Victoria Sponge Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Grease and line two 20cm/8in sandwich tins.
Cream the butter and the sugar together in a bowl until pale and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, a little at a time, and stir in the vanilla extract.
Fold in the flour using a large metal spoon, adding a little extra milk if necessary, to create a batter with a soft dropping consistency.
Divide the mixture between the cake tins and gently spread out with a spatula.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden-brown on top and a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and set aside for 5 minutes, then remove from the tin and peel off the paper. Place onto a wire rack.
Leave to cool completely.
Spread the jam onto one of the cakes. Whisk the double cream until soft peaks form when the whisk is removed.
Spread the cream over the jam, and then place the second sponge on top.
Sprinkle with icing sugar and serve.

name: Lemon Drizzle Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4.
Beat together 225g softened unsalted butter and 225g caster sugar until pale and creamy, then add 4 eggs, one at a time, slowly mixing through.
Sift in 225g self-raising flour, then add the finely grated zest of 1 lemon and mix until well combined.
Line a loaf tin (8 x 21cm) with greaseproof paper, then spoon in the mixture and level the top with a spoon.
Bake for 45-50 mins until a thin skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean.
While the cake is cooling in its tin, mix together the juice of 1 lemon and 85g caster sugar to make the drizzle.
Prick the warm cake all over with a skewer or fork, then pour over the drizzle.
Leave in the tin until completely cool, then remove and serve. Will keep in an airtight container for 3-4 days, or freeze for up to 1 month.

name: Chocolate Fudge Cake
steps: Heat oven to 160C/140C fan/gas 3. Grease and line a 20cm round cake tin with baking parchment.
Gently melt the butter, chocolate and golden syrup together in a large pan, stirring occasionally until smooth.
Remove from the heat. In a separate bowl beat the eggs, milk and vanilla extract together.
Pour the chocolate mixture and the egg mixture into the flour mixture and stir everything together until smooth.
Pour into the tin and bake for 1 hr 25 – 1 hr 30 mins until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean.
Leave to cool in the tin, then use a knife to level the top of the cake.
When completely cool, cut the cake in half horizontally.
To make the icing, melt the chocolate in a heatproof bowl over a pan of barely simmering water.
Remove from the heat, then stir in the icing sugar and just enough water to make it glossy and of a pouring consistency.
Sandwich the layers of cake together with just over half of the icing, then pour the rest on top, letting it dribble down the sides.

name: Coffee and Walnut Cake
steps: Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Grease and line the base of 2 x 20cm round sandwich tins with baking parchment.
Beat the butter and golden caster sugar together with electric beaters until pale and creamy.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well between each addition.
Fold in the self-raising flour, then the coffee and chopped walnuts.
Divide the mixture between the tins and level the tops.
Bake for 20-25 mins until golden and well risen, and a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean.
Cool in the tins for 5 mins, then turn out onto a wire rack and leave to cool completely.
Beat the unsalted butter until smooth and creamy, then beat in the icing sugar a little at a time until smooth.
Use half the icing to sandwich the cakes together, then spread the rest on top.
Decorate with walnut halves.

name: Classic Madeira Cake
steps: Heat oven to 160C/140C fan/gas 3. Grease and line a 900g/2lb loaf tin with a long strip of baking parchment.
Beat the butter and sugar together until pale and creamy, then add the eggs, one at a time, slowly mixing through.
Add a little flour if the mix starts to split. Stir in the flour, ground almonds, lemon zest, 1 tbsp lemon curd and a pinch of salt.
Spoon into the tin and level the top. Bake for 30 mins, then reduce oven to 150C/130C fan/gas 2 and bake for 30 mins more.
Cover with foil, then bake for another 30 mins until a skewer poked in comes out clean.
Cool in the tin, then lift out onto a wire rack over a baking tray.
Mix 2 tbsp lemon juice with the icing sugar, then spoon over the cake.
Leave to set for a few mins, then serve in slices with extra lemon curd, if you like.

name: Chocolate Marble Cake
steps: Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4.
Butter a 20 x 30cm tin and line the base with baking parchment.
Using electric beaters, beat the butter and sugar together until pale and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time.
Fold in the flour, followed by the milk, until smooth.
Divide the mixture between 2 bowls.
Stir the cocoa powder and 1 tbsp water into the mixture in one of the bowls.
Stir the melted chocolate and vanilla into the other mixture.
Spoon dollops of each mixture into the tin, then use a skewer to swirl them together.
Bake for 25-30 mins until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean.
Cool in the tin, then dust with icing sugar before serving.

name: Carrot Cake
steps: Heat the oven to 180C/fan160C/gas 4.
Oil and line the base and sides of an 18cm square cake tin with baking parchment.
Tip the sugar into a large mixing bowl, pour in the oil and add the eggs.
Lightly mix with a wooden spoon.
Stir in the grated carrots, raisins and orange zest.
Mix the flour, bicarbonate of soda and spices, then sift into the bowl.
Lightly mix all the ingredients - when everything is evenly amalgamated stop mixing.
The mixture will be fairly soft and almost runny.
Pour the mixture into the prepared tin and bake for 40- 45 minutes or until it feels firm and springy when you press it in the centre.
Cool in the tin for 5 minutes, then turn it out, peel off the paper and cool on a wire rack.
Beat together the frosting ingredients in a small bowl until smooth – you want the icing about as runny as single cream.
Set the cake on a serving plate and boldly drizzle the icing back and forth in diagonal lines over the top, letting it drip down the sides.

name: Red Velvet Cake
steps: Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4.
Grease and line 2 x 20cm sandwich tins with baking parchment.
Mix the flour, cocoa powder, bicarbonate of soda, baking powder and sugar in a bowl.
Beat the eggs, yogurt, vanilla extract, red food colouring and buttermilk together.
Pour wet ingredients into the dry and whisk until smooth.
Fold in the vinegar, then split the mixture between the tins.
Bake for 25 mins until risen and firm.
Cool, remove from tins, then make the frosting.
Whisk the icing sugar, butter and cream cheese together.
Spread over one of the cooled cakes.
Top with the other cake and decorate with sprinkles, if you like.

name: Banana Bread
steps: Heat oven to 180C/fan 160C/gas 4.
Butter a 2lb loaf tin and line the base and sides with baking parchment.
Cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy, then slowly add the beaten eggs with a little flour.
Fold in the remaining flour, baking powder, mashed bananas, chopped walnuts and vanilla extract.
Pour into the tin and bake for about 30 mins until a skewer comes out clean.
Cool in the tin for 10 mins, then remove to a wire rack.

name: Cherry Bakewell Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Grease and line the base of two 20cm (8in) sandwich tins.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Gradually beat in the eggs, one at a time, adding a little flour with each egg.
Fold in the remaining flour, ground almonds, almond extract, and milk.
Divide the mixture evenly between the prepared tins and smooth the tops.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until risen, golden and a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean.
Cool in the tins for 5 minutes then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Once cool, sandwich the cakes together with raspberry jam.
To make the glace icing, mix the powdered sugar with water until smooth and thick.
Spread the icing over the top of the cake, allowing it to drip down the sides.
Decorate with halved glace cherries.

name: Chocolate Stout Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 10-inch bundt pan.
In a medium saucepan, combine stout and butter. Heat until butter is melted.
Remove from heat and whisk in cocoa powder and sugar until smooth.
In a large bowl, whisk together sour cream, eggs, and vanilla.
Gradually whisk in stout mixture.
Add flour and whisk until smooth.
Pour batter into prepared pan and smooth the top.
Bake for 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove from pan and cool completely on a wire rack.
Once cooled, make the frosting by beating marshmallow fluff and heavy cream together until light and fluffy.
Spread frosting over the top of the cake.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Vegan Birthday Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together almond milk, vegetable oil, apple cider vinegar, and vanilla extract.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and mix until smooth. Fold in rainbow sprinkles.
Divide batter evenly between prepared cake pans.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Remove cakes from oven and let cool in pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.
Once cooled, frost the top of one cake layer with vegan buttercream frosting.
Place the second cake layer on top and frost the top and sides of the entire cake with remaining frosting.
Decorate with additional rainbow sprinkles if desired.
Slice and serve!

name: Citrus, Almond & Yogurt Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9-inch round cake pan.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, ground almonds, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, mix together Greek yogurt, granulated sugar, eggs, vegetable oil, lemon zest, orange zest, orange juice, and lemon juice until smooth.
Gradually mix dry ingredients into wet ingredients until just combined.
Pour batter into prepared pan and smooth the top.
Sprinkle sliced almonds evenly over the top of the batter.
Bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow cake to cool in pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Once cooled, dust with powdered sugar before serving.

name: Butterfly Cupcakes
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper liners.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream together softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla extract.
Gradually mix in the dry ingredients alternating with milk until just combined.
Fill each muffin cup about 2/3 full with batter.
Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow cupcakes to cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Once cooled, cut a small cone-shaped piece out of the top of each cupcake.
Fill each hole with raspberry jam.
Replace the top of the cupcake.
In a small bowl, whisk together powdered sugar and water until smooth to make the glaze.
Spread or drizzle glaze over the top of each cupcake.
Decorate with buttercream frosting and sprinkles if desired.

name: Swiss Meringue Buttercream
steps: Fill a saucepan with a few inches of water and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
In a heatproof bowl (preferably metal), whisk together egg whites and sugar.
Place the bowl over the simmering water, making sure the bottom of the bowl doesn't touch the water.
Whisk constantly until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture reaches 160°F (71°C) on a candy thermometer.
Remove from heat and transfer the mixture to a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment.
Whip on high speed until stiff peaks form and the mixture has cooled to room temperature, about 10-15 minutes.
Reduce speed to medium and add the butter, a few cubes at a time, mixing well after each addition.
Once all the butter is incorporated, add vanilla extract and mix until smooth and creamy.
Use immediately or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week.

name: Tottenham Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9-inch square cake pan.
In a large mixing bowl, cream together softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs, one at a time, until well combined. Stir in vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt.
Gradually add dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with milk, beginning and ending with dry ingredients.
Spread half of the batter into prepared cake pan.
Dollop raspberry jam over the batter, then spread the remaining batter over the jam.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Once cooled, dust with powdered sugar before serving.

name: Dundee Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C). Grease and line a 9-inch round cake pan with parchment paper.
In a large mixing bowl, cream together softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs, one at a time, until well combined.
In a separate bowl, sift together flour and baking powder.
Fold dry ingredients into the butter mixture until just combined.
Fold in ground almonds, mixed dried fruit, and candied peel until evenly distributed.
Pour batter into prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
Arrange whole almonds in a decorative pattern on top of the cake.
Bake for 2-2.5 hours, or until a skewer inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Once cooled, brush the top of the cake with heated apricot jam for a glossy finish.

name: Peach Melba Roulade
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a 10x15-inch jelly roll pan with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, beat eggs and granulated sugar until thick and pale.
In a separate bowl, sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt.
Gradually fold dry ingredients into egg mixture until just combined.
Spread batter evenly into prepared pan and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until cake springs back when lightly touched.
While the cake is still warm, sprinkle confectioners' sugar over a clean kitchen towel.
Invert cake onto towel and carefully peel off parchment paper.
Roll up cake in the towel jelly-roll style, starting with a short side. Cool completely on a wire rack.
In a medium bowl, beat heavy cream and vanilla extract until stiff peaks form.
Carefully unroll cooled cake and spread raspberry jam evenly over the surface.
Top with sliced peaches and fresh raspberries.
Spread whipped cream over fruit in an even layer.
Roll up cake again, using towel to help lift and roll.
Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.
Slice and serve chilled.

name: Madeira Loaf Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 325°F (160°C). Grease and flour a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
In a large mixing bowl, cream together softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs, one at a time, until well combined. Stir in vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, sift together flour, baking powder, and salt.
Gradually add dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with milk, beginning and ending with dry ingredients.
Fold in lemon zest and lemon juice until evenly distributed.
Pour batter into prepared loaf pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
Bake for 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Once cooled, whisk together powdered sugar and enough lemon juice to make a thick glaze.
Drizzle glaze over the top of the cake, allowing it to drip down the sides.
Let the glaze set before slicing and serving.

name: Raspberry Bakewell Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9-inch round cake pan.
In a large mixing bowl, cream together softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs, one at a time, until well combined. Stir in almond extract.
Gradually add flour and ground almonds to the butter mixture, mixing until just combined.
Spread half of the batter into prepared cake pan.
Dollop raspberry jam over the batter, then spread the remaining batter over the jam.
Arrange fresh raspberries on top of the cake batter and sprinkle with sliced almonds.
Bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Once cooled, whisk together powdered sugar and water to make a glaze.
Drizzle glaze over the top of the cake before serving.

name: Parkin
steps: Preheat the oven to 140C/275F/Gas 1. Grease and line a 20cm/8in square cake tin with baking parchment.
Mix the oatmeal, butter, syrup, treacle, sugar, eggs, milk, flour and ginger together in a bowl until well combined.
Pour the mixture into the prepared tin and bake in the middle of the oven for 1-1½ hours, or until the cake has set and is firm to the touch.
Remove the cake from the oven and set aside to cool on a wire rack.

name: Easy Simnel Traybake
steps: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C Fan/Gas 4. Line a 20cm/8in square cake tin with baking parchment.
Cream the butter and sugar together in a bowl until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then fold in the flour, almonds, baking powder, dried fruit, and glacé cherries until well combined.
Spoon half of the mixture into the prepared cake tin and smooth the surface.
Roll out the marzipan to the size of the tin and place on top of the cake mixture.
Spoon the remaining cake mixture on top and level the surface.
Bake in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes, or until risen and golden-brown and a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and leave to cool in the tin for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Coconut & Raspberry Cupcakes
steps: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C Fan/Gas 4. Line a 12-hole muffin tin with paper cases.
Cream the butter and sugar together in a bowl until pale and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, until well combined.
Fold in the flour and desiccated coconut until just combined.
Divide the mixture evenly between the paper cases and press a raspberry into the centre of each one.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until risen and golden-brown and a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Once cool, sift the icing sugar into a bowl and gradually stir in enough water to make a smooth, thick icing.
Drizzle the icing over the cooled cupcakes and leave to set before serving.

name: Little Lemon-Tons
steps: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C Fan/Gas 4. Line a 12-hole muffin tin with paper cases.
Cream the butter and sugar together in a bowl until pale and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, until well combined.
Fold in the flour, lemon zest, lemon juice, and milk until just combined.
Divide the mixture evenly between the paper cases.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until risen and golden-brown and a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Once cool, sift the icing sugar into a bowl and gradually stir in enough water to make a smooth, thick icing.
Drizzle the icing over the cooled cupcakes and leave to set before serving.

name: Eton Mess Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C Fan/Gas 4. Grease and line two 20cm/8in round cake tins with baking parchment.
Cream the butter and sugar together in a bowl until pale and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract.
Fold in the flour until just combined.
Divide the mixture between the prepared cake tins and smooth the tops with a spatula.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until risen and golden-brown and a skewer inserted into the centre of each cake comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and leave to cool in the tins for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Once cool, whip the double cream and vanilla extract together in a bowl until soft peaks form.
Crumble the meringue nests into the cream and gently fold in, along with the strawberries.
Sandwich the cakes together with the cream mixture and serve immediately.

name: Ginger Treacle Sponge
steps: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C Fan/Gas 4. Grease and line a 20cm/8in round cake tin with baking parchment.
Sift the flour, bicarbonate of soda, ginger, and cinnamon into a bowl.
Cream the butter and sugar together in a separate bowl until pale and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the black treacle.
Fold in the flour mixture until just combined, then stir in the milk.
Pour the mixture into the prepared cake tin and smooth the surface with a spatula.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until risen and golden-brown and a skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and leave to cool in the tin for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Ultimate Chocolate Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C Fan/Gas 4. Grease and line two 20cm/8in round cake tins with baking parchment.
Melt the chocolate in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of simmering water, then set aside to cool slightly.
Cream the sugar and butter together in a bowl until pale and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the melted chocolate.
Fold in the flour and cocoa powder until just combined, then stir in the milk.
Divide the mixture between the prepared cake tins and smooth the tops with a spatula.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until risen and golden-brown and a skew
er inserted into the centre of each cake comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and leave to cool in the tins for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Macarons
steps: Preheat the oven to 150°C/300°F/Gas 2 and line two baking trays with baking parchment.
Blend the icing sugar and ground almonds in a food processor until fine, then sift into a large bowl.
Whisk the egg whites in a separate bowl until they form soft peaks, then gradually whisk in the caster sugar until stiff peaks form.
Fold the egg white mixture into the almond mixture until smooth, then add the vanilla extract and food coloring (if using) and mix until combined.
Transfer the mixture to a piping bag fitted with a plain nozzle and pipe small rounds onto the prepared baking trays.
Tap the trays on the work surface to remove any air bubbles, then leave to stand for 30 minutes.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until firm to the touch.
Remove from the oven and leave to cool on the trays for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
To make the filling, beat the butter in a bowl until soft, then gradually beat in the sifted icing sugar until smooth and creamy.
Add the milk and beat until light and fluffy.
Spread or pipe the filling onto half of the macarons, then sandwich together with the remaining macarons.

name: Profiterole
steps: Preheat the oven to 200C/180C Fan/Gas 6 and line a baking sheet with baking parchment.
Place the water and butter in a saucepan over a low heat and heat gently until the butter has melted.
Increase the heat and bring to the boil, then remove from the heat and quickly beat in the flour until the mixture comes together in a smooth ball.
Transfer the mixture to a mixing bowl and leave to cool for 5 minutes.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, until smooth and glossy.
Transfer the mixture to a piping bag fitted with a plain nozzle and pipe small mounds onto the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until risen and golden-brown.
Remove from the oven and pierce each profiterole with a skewer to release the steam, then return to the oven for a further 5 minutes to dry out.
Remove from the oven and leave to cool on a wire rack.
Once cool, whip the double cream until stiff peaks form.
Cut the tops off the profiteroles and fill with the whipped cream.
Melt the chocolate in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of simmering water, then drizzle over the filled profiteroles.
Dust with icing sugar before serving.

name: Religieuse
steps: Preheat the oven to 200C/180C Fan/Gas 6 and line a baking sheet with baking parchment.
Place the water, butter, and salt in a saucepan over a low heat and heat gently until the butter has melted.
Increase the heat and bring to the boil, then remove from the heat and quickly beat in the flour until the mixture comes together in a smooth ball.
Transfer the mixture to a mixing bowl and leave to cool for 5 minutes.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, until smooth and glossy.
Transfer the mixture to a piping bag fitted with a plain nozzle and pipe small mounds onto the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until risen and golden-brown.
Remove from the oven and pierce each profiterole with a skewer to release the steam, then return to the oven for a further 5 minutes to dry out.
Remove from the oven and leave to cool on a wire rack.
Once cool, whip the double cream until stiff peaks form.
Cut the tops off the profiteroles and fill with the whipped cream.
Melt the chocolate in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of simmering water, then drizzle over the filled profiteroles.

name: Pain Au Chocolat

ingredients.name: dark chocolate, broken into small pieces

steps: Sift the flour and salt into a large bowl, then stir in the dried yeast and make a well in the centre.
Pour the lukewarm water into the well and add the caster sugar and beaten egg.
Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until a dough forms.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 10 minutes, or until smooth and elastic.
Transfer the dough to a lightly oiled bowl, cover with a clean tea towel, and leave to rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours, or until doubled in size.
Preheat the oven to 200C/180C Fan/Gas 6 and line a baking sheet with baking parchment.
Punch down the risen dough and turn out onto a lightly floured surface.
Roll out the dough into a large rectangle, then brush with the melted butter and scatter over the chocolate pieces.
Roll up the dough tightly from one of the long edges to form a log, then cut into slices.
Place the slices onto the prepared baking sheet, leaving space between each one, and leave to rise for a further 30 minutes.
Brush the risen pain au chocolat with the beaten egg yolk, then bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until risen and golden-brown.
Remove from the oven and transfer to a wire rack to cool slightly before serving.

name: Mille Feuille
steps: Preheat the oven to 200C/180C Fan/Gas 6.
Roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of 3mm.
Cut the pastry into three equal rectangles and place on a baking sheet lined with baking parchment.
Prick the pastry all over with a fork, then place another sheet of baking parchment on top and weigh down with another baking sheet to prevent the pastry from puffing up too much.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until golden-brown and crisp.
Remove from the oven and leave to cool completely.
Whip the double cream with the icing sugar and vanilla extract until stiff peaks form.
Place one rectangle of pastry on a serving plate and spread half of the whipped cream over the top.
Arrange half of the strawberries, raspberries, and blueberries on top of the cream.
Place another rectangle of pastry on top and press down gently.
Spread the remaining whipped cream over the top and arrange the remaining berries on top.
Place the final rectangle of pastry on top and press down gently.
Dust with icing sugar before serving.

name: Éclair
steps: Preheat the oven to 200C/180C Fan/Gas 6 and line a baking sheet with baking parchment.
Place the water, butter, and salt in a saucepan over a low heat and heat gently until the butter has melted.
Increase the heat and bring to the boil, then remove from the heat and quickly beat in the flour until the mixture comes together in a smooth ball.
Transfer the mixture to a mixing bowl and leave to cool for 5 minutes.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, until smooth and glossy.
Transfer the mixture to a piping bag fitted with a plain nozzle and pipe lengths onto the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until risen and golden-brown.
Remove from the oven and pierce each éclair with a skewer to release the steam, then return to the oven for a further 5 minutes to dry out.
Remove from the oven and leave to cool on a wire rack.
Once cool, whip the double cream until stiff peaks form.
Cut the cooled éclairs in half horizontally and fill with the whipped cream.
Melt the chocolate in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of simmering water, then drizzle over the filled éclairs.
Dust with icing sugar before serving.

name: Madeleine
steps: Preheat the oven to 190C/170C Fan/Gas 5 and butter the madeleine molds.
In a bowl, beat the eggs and sugar until pale and thick.
Gently fold in the flour and baking powder.
Add the melted butter and vanilla extract, and mix until smooth.
Spoon the batter into the prepared molds, filling each about two-thirds full.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown.
Remove from the oven and transfer to a wire rack to cool.

name: Cannele
steps: In a saucepan, heat the milk and butter until the butter has melted. Let it cool slightly.
In a bowl, mix the eggs and sugar until well combined.
Gradually add the flour, vanilla extract, and rum to the egg mixture.
Slowly pour in the milk mixture, stirring constantly until smooth.
Let the batter rest in the refrigerator for at least 24 hours.
Preheat the oven to 200C/180C Fan/Gas 6 and butter the cannele molds.
Pour the batter into the molds, filling them about three-quarters full.
Bake for 60-70 minutes, or until the outside is dark brown and the inside is soft.
Remove from the oven and let cool in the molds before unmolding.

name: Kouign Amann
steps: In a bowl, mix the flour, salt, and yeast. Add the water and mix until a dough forms.
Knead the dough for about 5-10 minutes until smooth.
Let the dough rise for 1 hour until doubled in size.
Roll out the dough into a large rectangle.
Spread the cold butter over two-thirds of the dough, then fold the unbuttered third over the middle third, and then the remaining third over that.
Turn the dough 90 degrees and roll out again. Repeat the folding process three times.
Sprinkle the sugar over the dough and fold again.
Preheat the oven to 200C/180C Fan/Gas 6.
Cut the dough into squares and place in a buttered muffin tin.
Bake for 30-40 minutes until golden brown and caramelized.
Let cool in the tin for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Chouquette
steps: Preheat the oven to 200C/180C Fan/Gas 6 and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a saucepan, bring the water, butter, and salt to a boil.
Remove from heat and add the flour all at once, stirring until the mixture comes together and forms a ball.
Let the mixture cool for 5 minutes.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition, until the dough is smooth and shiny.
Transfer the dough to a piping bag fitted with a plain nozzle.
Pipe small mounds of dough onto the prepared baking sheet.
Sprinkle with pearl sugar.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until puffed and golden brown.
Let cool on a wire rack before serving.

name: Espresso Bundt Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and flour a bundt pan.
In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
In another bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture alternately with the buttermilk, beginning and ending with the flour mixture.
Stir in the espresso powder and vanilla extract.
Pour the batter into the prepared bundt pan.
Bake for 50-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Zucchini Coffee Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease a 9x13-inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, beat together the sugar, brown sugar, and oil until well combined.
Add the eggs and vanilla extract, and mix until smooth.
In another bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing just until combined.
Fold in the grated zucchini.
Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan.
Bake for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cake cool in the pan before slicing and serving.

name: Red, White, and Blue Ice-Cream Cake
steps: Let the strawberry ice cream soften at room temperature for 10-15 minutes.
Spread the softened strawberry ice cream in an even layer in a 9-inch springform pan. Freeze for 1 hour until firm.
Let the vanilla ice cream soften at room temperature for 10-15 minutes.
Spread the softened vanilla ice cream over the strawberry layer. Freeze for 1 hour until firm.
Let the blueberry ice cream soften at room temperature for 10-15 minutes.
Spread the softened blueberry ice cream over the vanilla layer. Freeze for 1 hour until firm.
Remove the cake from the springform pan and place on a serving platter.
Frost the top and sides of the cake with whipped cream.
Decorate with fresh strawberries and blueberries before serving.

name: Pandan Chiffon Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 170C/150C Fan/Gas 3 and prepare a chiffon cake pan (do not grease).
In a large bowl, whisk the egg yolks and 100g of sugar until pale and thick.
Add the coconut milk, vanilla extract, and pandan juice, and whisk until well combined.
Sift in the cake flour and baking powder, and mix until smooth.
In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites with the cream of tartar until soft peaks form.
Gradually add the remaining 100g of sugar and whisk until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold the egg white mixture into the egg yolk mixture until well combined.
Pour the batter into the chiffon cake pan and smooth the top.
Bake for 50-60 minutes, or until a skewer inserted into the center comes out clean.
Invert the pan and let the cake cool completely before removing from the pan.

name: Hummingbird Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and flour three 9-inch round cake pans.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
Add the eggs and vegetable oil, and stir until moistened.
Stir in the vanilla extract, pineapple, pecans, and bananas, and mix until well combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pans.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then turn out onto wire racks to cool completely.

name: German Chocolate Cupcakes
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and line a muffin tin with cupcake liners.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, beat the sugar and butter until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in the vanilla extract.
Alternately add the flour mixture and buttermilk to the butter mixture, beginning and ending with the flour mixture.
Stir in the boiling water until the batter is smooth.
Pour the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each liner about two-thirds full.
Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cupcakes cool in the tin for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
For the frosting, combine the sweetened shredded coconut, chopped pecans, and sweetened condensed milk in a bowl. Mix well.
Top each cooled cupcake with a spoonful of the coconut-pecan frosting.

name: Ube Cheesecake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease a 9-inch springform pan.
In a bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and melted butter. Press into the bottom of the pan to form the crust.
In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese and sugar until smooth.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in the vanilla extract and sour cream.
Fold in the ube jam until well combined.
Pour the batter over the crust in the springform pan.
Bake for 50-60 minutes or until the center is set.
Let the cheesecake cool in the pan, then refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.

name: Funfetti Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in the vanilla extract.
Alternately add the flour mixture and milk to the butter mixture, beginning and ending with the flour mixture.
Fold in the rainbow sprinkles.
Pour the batter into the prepared pans and spread evenly.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then turn out onto wire racks to cool completely.

name: Checkerboard Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and flour three 9-inch round cake pans.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in the vanilla extract.
Alternately add the flour mixture and milk to the butter mixture, beginning and ending with the flour mixture.
Divide the batter in half. Stir cocoa powder into one half of the batter until well combined.
Using a checkerboard cake divider, fill the prepared pans with alternating rings of vanilla and chocolate batter.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then turn out onto wire racks to cool completely.

name: Rose Petal Pound Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and flour a 9-inch loaf pan.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in the vanilla extract and rose water.
Alternately add the flour mixture and milk to the butter mixture, beginning and ending with the flour mixture.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 60-70 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Garnish with edible rose petals before serving.

name: Cinnamon Toast Crunch Apple Dump Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Spread the apple pie filling evenly in the bottom of the prepared dish.
Sprinkle the yellow cake mix evenly over the apple pie filling.
Drizzle the melted butter over the cake mix.
Sprinkle the Cinnamon Toast Crunch cereal evenly on top.
Bake for 45-50 minutes or until the top is golden brown and bubbly.
Let the cake cool for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Genoise Sponge
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and flour a 9-inch round cake pan.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour and salt.
In a heatproof bowl, combine the sugar and eggs. Place the bowl over a pot of simmering water and whisk until the mixture is warm and the sugar is dissolved.
Remove from heat and beat with an electric mixer until thick and pale.
Fold in the vanilla extract and flour mixture.
Fold in the melted butter until well combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Blueberry Shortcake
steps: Preheat the oven to 425F (220C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Cut in the chilled butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in the milk and vanilla extract until just combined.
Drop the dough by spoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.
In a bowl, toss the fresh blueberries with the sugar.
In another bowl, whip the heavy cream until stiff peaks form.
Split the shortcakes in half and fill with the blueberry mixture and whipped cream.

name: Tiramisu Crepe Cake
steps: In a bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, and salt.
In another bowl, combine the milk, eggs, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Gradually whisk the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until smooth.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with butter.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter into the skillet and swirl to coat the bottom.
Cook until the edges are set and the bottom is golden brown, about 1-2 minutes. Flip and cook for another 30 seconds.
Repeat with the remaining batter, stacking the crepes on a plate and covering with a clean towel to keep warm.
In a bowl, combine the strong brewed coffee and sugar until dissolved. Set aside to cool.
In another bowl, beat the mascarpone cheese, heavy cream, and sugar until stiff peaks form.
To assemble, place one crepe on a serving plate and brush with the coffee mixture. Spread a thin layer of the mascarpone filling on top.
Repeat with the remaining crepes, brushing each with coffee and spreading with filling.
Dust the top of the cake with cocoa powder before serving.

name: Italian Berry Mascarpone Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in the mascarpone cheese and vanilla extract.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, alternating with the milk, until just combined.
Fold in the mixed berries.
Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans and spread evenly.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then turn out onto wire racks to cool completely.

name: Choc Caramel Fudge Layer Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and flour three 9-inch round cake pans.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cocoa powder.
In another bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in the vanilla extract.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, alternating with the buttermilk, until just combined.
Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans and spread evenly.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then turn out onto wire racks to cool completely.
Spread a layer of caramel sauce on top of one cake layer, then top with another cake layer. Repeat with the remaining cake layers and caramel sauce.
Spread the chocolate fudge frosting over the top and sides of the cake.

name: Russian Honey Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a heatproof bowl, combine the butter, sugar, and honey. Place the bowl over a pot of simmering water and whisk until the butter is melted and the mixture is smooth.
Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
Stir in the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Gradually add the flour mixture, stirring until a dough forms.
Divide the dough into 8 equal portions. Roll each portion into a thin circle and place on the prepared baking sheets.
Bake for 5-7 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool completely.
In a bowl, beat the sour cream and heavy cream until stiff peaks form. Gradually add the powdered sugar, beating until smooth.
To assemble, spread a layer of the cream mixture on top of one cake layer, then top with another cake layer. Repeat with the remaining cake layers and cream mixture.
Chill the assembled cake in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours before serving.

name: Orange Syrup Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and flour a 9-inch round cake pan.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in the vanilla extract.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, alternating with the orange juice and milk, until just combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack.
Brush the warm cake with the orange syrup. Let the cake cool completely before serving.

name: Fairy Bread Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and flour a 9-inch round cake pan.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in the vanilla extract.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, alternating with the buttermilk, until just combined.
Fold in the rainbow sprinkles.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Frost with whipped cream and decorate with additional sprinkles before serving.

name: Swedish Sandwich Cake (Smorgastarta)
steps: In a bowl, mix the cream cheese and mayonnaise until smooth.
Spread a layer of the cream cheese mixture on a slice of bread.
Top with a layer of smoked salmon and another slice of bread.
Spread another layer of cream cheese mixture and top with a layer of shrimp.
Continue layering with cucumber slices, lettuce, and hard-boiled eggs, spreading the cream cheese mixture between each layer.
Top with a final slice of bread.
Cover the entire sandwich cake with a layer of sour cream.
Decorate with fresh dill and caviar.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving.

name: Ginger and Pear Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and flour a 9x13-inch baking pan.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and ground ginger.
In another bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in the vanilla extract.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, alternating with the sour cream, until just combined.
Fold in the diced pears and chopped crystallized ginger.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cake cool completely in the pan before slicing and serving.

name: Chocolate Mud Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and flour a 9x13-inch baking pan.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a saucepan, melt the butter over low heat. Remove from heat and stir in the sugar until dissolved.
Whisk in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the wet ingredients, alternating with the water, until smooth.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cake cool completely in the pan before slicing and serving.

name: Pistachio and Cardamom Cake with Grapefruit Curd
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and flour a 9x13-inch baking pan.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, ground pistachios, baking powder, cardamom, and salt.
In another bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in the vanilla extract.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, alternating with the milk, until just combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cake cool completely in the pan before spreading the grapefruit curd over the top.
Slice and serve.

name: Coconut Chiffon Cake with Meringue Icing
steps: Preheat the oven to 325F (160C) and prepare a tube pan.
In a large bowl, sift together the cake flour, shredded coconut, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, oil, coconut milk, and vanilla extract.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until smooth.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites with cream of tartar until stiff peaks form.
Gradually add the sugar and beat until glossy.
Gently fold the egg whites into the batter until fully incorporated.
Pour the batter into the prepared tube pan and smooth the top.
Bake for 55-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Invert the cake pan onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Once cool, run a knife around the edges to release the cake.
Top with meringue icing.

name: Coconut Sponge with Raspberries and Mascarpone
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and line two 8-inch round cake pans with parchment paper.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, desiccated coconut, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, alternating with the coconut milk, until smooth.
Divide the batter evenly between the prepared cake pans and smooth the tops.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Once the cakes are cool, spread raspberry jam over the top of one cake layer.
Place the other cake layer on top.
In a bowl, mix together the mascarpone cheese and powdered sugar until smooth.
Spread the mascarpone mixture over the top of the cake.
Top with fresh raspberries.
Slice and serve.

name: Orange and White Chocolate Buttercream Layer Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in the orange zest and orange juice.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, alternating with the buttermilk, until just combined.
Stir in the vanilla extract.
Divide the batter evenly between the prepared cake pans and smooth the tops.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
In a bowl, beat the softened butter until creamy.
Gradually add the powdered sugar, beating until smooth.
Beat in the melted white chocolate, orange extract, and orange juice until well combined.
Add the heavy cream and beat until fluffy.
Once the cakes are completely cooled, spread a layer of buttercream on top of one cake layer.
Place the other cake layer on top and frost the top and sides of the cake with the remaining buttercream.
Garnish with orange zest.
Slice and serve.

name: Rocky Road Chocolate Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350F (175C) and grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, beat together the granulated sugar, brown sugar, milk, vegetable oil, eggs, and vanilla extract until well combined.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until smooth.
Stir in the boiling water until the batter is well combined.
Fold in the chopped pecans, mini marshmallows, and chocolate chips.
Divide the batter evenly between the prepared cake pans and smooth the tops.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Once the cakes are completely cooled, frost the top of one cake layer with chocolate frosting.
Place the other cake layer on top and frost the top and sides of the cake with the remaining frosting.
Garnish with additional pecans, marshmallows, and chocolate chips if desired.
Slice and serve.
